comment.author: 53461717@N08
comment._content: José Venustiano Carranza Garza (Cuatro Ciénegas, Coahuila, 28 December 1859 –Tlaxcalaltongo, Puebla, 21 May 1920) es.wikipedia.org/wiki/Venustiano_Carranza Compare in this photostream with www.flickr.com/photos/library_of_congress/4445094837/ photo most likely taken on November 4, 1913.

comment.author: 35072786@N08
comment._content: Thank you infrogmation and jerodamor@yahoo.com.mx.  We will add more biographical details about Venustiano Carranza to the image description.

comment.author: 53461717@N08
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/arden_loc] I made a copy with Windows Live Photo Gallery, then with Paint extracted and enlarged the sticker on the right upper corner, again with Windows Live Photo Gallery darkened the sticker with the histogram and found 11/9/15 (November 9, 1915?). Maybe you can try the same or with other applications and see what you find. In August 1915, Carranza's troops entered Mexico City a second time. The United States recognized Carranza as President of Mexico in October 1915 and by the end of the year, Villa was on the run, in: en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Venustiano_Carranza
